Links

Links are used for navigation between or within screens.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Links in Text

Some links will appear within blocks of text.

How Can Our Brand Be Used

We're usually conservative with requests to use our brand, and most requests are denied. However, if a strong business case can be made showing the benefits to John Deere, we might proceed. This site gives you the tools you need to help promote and protect our brand.

The Brand Portal covers most questions regarding the use of our brand. Review the guidelines to see what we look for when people ask to use the John Deere brand.

Links in Data Display

Some links will appear within more organized data display sections.

Icons in Links

Card title

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.

View Heavy Equipment Lineup

Guidelines

For all links in general or neutral sites, text should be John Deere Green and be underlined in both the inactive and hover states.  For links in Construction and Power Systems sites, text should appear dark charcoal (#54585a) instead of John Deere Green.

  • Links may also be used to change what or how data is displayed, as in the case of “view more” or “show all”.
  • If the action taken by the user will manipulate data, use a button instead.

Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" add to your a element to open up link in a new tab. You must add "noopener noreferrer" in order to avoid a security vulnerability known as reverse tabnabbing.
